name: Baked Curry Triangles
author: BananaBake
summary: Here's a homemade recipe that I've grown up loving in the comfort of my home: baked curry triangles. My mom would bake these delicious goods for the family, and we'd enjoy them with happiness.
ingredients: 5 tablespoons curry powder, or more to taste
1 sheet puff pastry, cut into 6 squares
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Cook and stir beef and onion in a nonstick skillet until beef is browned, about 5 minutes
Stir in curry powder until heated through and fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Cut puff pastry squares diagonally to create 12 triangles
Fold each triangle in half, pressing the edges of one side together, and leaving an opening for the filling
Fill each triangle with curried beef and press edges to seal
Coat each triangle with beaten egg using a pastry brush
Arrange triangles on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until puffed up and golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes
